words.def: the cardinal number that is the sum of one and one and one
the fifth and highest element after air and earth and fire and water
The name of the letter ⟨⟩, which stands for the th sound in Pitman shorthand .
a tall perennial woody plant having a main trunk and branches forming a distinct elevated crown
a network of intersecting blood vessels or intersecting nerves or intersecting lymph vessels
With a comparative or more and a verb phrase, establishes a parallel with one or more other such comparatives.

A letter capital Ð, small ð introduced into Old English to represent its dental fricative, then not distinguished from the letter thorn, no longer used in English but still in modern use in Icelandic, Faroese, and phonetics to represent the voiced dental fricative "th" sound as in the English word then.
made warm or hot (`het' is a dialectal variant of `heated')
the starting place for each hole on a golf course
place (flax, hemp, or jute) in liquid so as to promote loosening of the fibers from the woody tissue
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
